p: The methanol extract of J. mimosifolia exhibited relatively comparable antioxidant properties to the commonly used antioxidant ascorbic acid. Differences in antioxidant activities could be related to the antioxidant components extracted from the different J. mimosifolia fractions. Several significant correlation coefficients were found between phenolic compounds and DPPH (R 2 = 0.942*), H 2O 2 (R 2 = 0.979**), OH (R 2 = 0.964*), O 2 -1 (R 2 = 0.995**) and reducing power (R 2 = 0.992**) ( Table 5). Flavonoids also showed significant correlations with hydrogen peroxide (R 2 = 0.939**), O 2 -1 (R 2 = 0.954*) and reducing power (R 2 = 0.967*). These correlations strongly suggest the involvement of phenolic compounds in the antioxidant activities. This result is in agreement with previous reports that have demonstrated a linear correlation between TPC and the reducing antioxidant capacity of plant extracts [ 84, 85].
